Question_1.Context: The paper discusses the influence of zirconium phosphate nanoparticles on reducing the diameter of nanofibres during electrospinning.
Question_1.Question: What is the main purpose of adding zirconium phosphate nanoparticles to the PAN nanofibres?
Question_1.A: To increase the diameter of the nanofibres
Question_1.B: To decrease the diameter of the nanofibres
Question_1.C: To add color to the nanofibres
Question_1.D: To improve the thermal stability of the nanofibres
Question_1.Source: Addition of metal oxide such as zirconium phosphate decreases the diameter and smooths on the polyacrylonitrile (PAN) nanofibres as observed by the SEM techniques.

Question_2.Context: The paper explores the effect of zirconium phosphate on the morphology and conductivity of modified PAN nanofibres.
Question_2.Question: What range of diameters were observed for the PAN/zirconium phosphate nanofibres?
Question_2.Source: The PAN/zirconium phosphate nanofibres were obtained with the diameter ranges between 100 and 200 nm.

Question_3.Context: The paper discusses the conductivity improvement of PAN and PAN-Nafion zirconium phosphate nanofibres.
Question_3.Question: How was the conductivity of PAN and PAN-Nafion zirconium phosphate nanofibres compared to plain PAN nanofibres?
Question_3.Source: The conductivity of PAN and PAN-Nafion zirconium phosphate nanofibres was more improved when compared to that of the plain PAN nanofibres.

Question_4.Context: The paper mentions the thermal properties of PAN and PAN-Nafion zirconium phosphate nanofibres.
Question_4.Question: How did the thermal gravimetric analysis results of plain PAN nanofibres compare to the modified PAN with zirconium phosphate nanoparticles?
Question_4.A: Plain PAN showed higher thermal stability
Question_4.B: Modified PAN showed higher thermal stability
Question_4.Source: The plain PAN nanofibres show the total degradation on thermal gravimetric analysis results when compared to the modified PAN with zirconium phosphate nanoparticles.

Question_5.Context: The paper discusses the potential applications of PAN/ZrP nanofibres.
Question_5.Question: What is mentioned as a potential application of PAN/ZrP nanofibres?
Question_5.Source: The thermal properties and proton conductivity make the PAN/ZrP nanofibres as promising nanofillers for fuel cell electrolytes.

Question_6.Context: The paper mentions the properties of zirconium oxide (ZrO2) and its applications.
Question_6.Question: What is one of the properties of zirconium oxide mentioned in the text?
Question_6.Source: Zirconium oxide (ZrO2) has several properties that make it a useful material. These properties include high density, hardness, electrical conductivity, wear resistance, high fracture toughness...

Question_7.Context: The paper discusses the properties of zirconium phosphates (ZrPs) and their applications.
Question_7.Question: What feature of zirconium phosphate contributes to increasing conductivity?
Question_7.Source: Zirconium phosphate has the features of increasing conductivity due to high proton mobility on the surface of its particles and good water retention.

Question_8.Context: The paper mentions the preparation of electrospinning solutions for PAN nanofibres.
Question_8.Question: What was added to the PAN solution to prepare PAN/ZrP nanofibres?
Question_8.Source: In order to prepare the PAN/ZrP nanofibres, 0.1 wt% ZrP nanoparticles were added to the obtained solution...

Question_9.Context: The paper discusses the characterisation techniques used for the nanofibres.
Question_9.Question: Which technique was used to analyse the thermal properties of the samples?
Question_9.Source: The thermal properties of the samples and their characteristics were studied by thermal gravimetric analysis (TGA) under nitrogen flow.

Question_10.Context: The paper discusses the electrochemical studies conducted on the nanofibres.
Question_10.Question: What was used as the reference electrode in the electrochemical measurements?
Question_10.Source: Electrochemical measurements were observed under three electrodes. While a silver-silver chloride (Ag/AgCl) electrode was used as the reference electrode...
